author: yannicvandekuit
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

For my example i used a simple script to output "Test":
`Write-Output "Test"`

Running the script from Command line result in unstable results.
Several times, the script will run correctly.
However after a running the scripts a few times, the script will not execute.

For running scripts in MSBuild, i get the same result. The script gets called by MSBuild, however the build will stop there as the script is not executed.



### Expected behavior

```console
Test
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Script not executing consistently
```


### Error details

```console
No Error returned
```


### Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

As seen in the image below, the scripts runs correct several times and outputs "Test".
At the last time we see the command is send, but the script is not executed.
Within the process explorer we see that pwsh.exe is running. When i close this one, the command line also works again as intended.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25219371/145573240-0fa08d5e-6983-4328-bd17-951e1e1aa24b.png)

`D:\experiments\Test.ps` indeed only contains `Write-Ourput "Test"`, and the `cmd.exe` process is running as a 64-bit process.

Using  `"c:\Program Files\PowerShell\7\pwsh.exe" -noprofile D:\experiments\Test.ps1` also results in the same problem.

comments.body: @yannicvandekuit Can you run your script with `pwsh -noninteractive` and share results?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @yannicvandekuit I cannot reproduce the hang locally. I'm afraid you will have to collect a dump from your repro, by [dotnet-dump](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/diagnostics/dotnet-dump). Please use `dotnet-dump collect -p <process-id> --type Heap -o <path-to-dump-file>`. Please share the dump in some way (OneDrive, etc.), and we will take a look.
